results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Tim Kanoa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.

results.title: Women of the iron frontier
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
results.brief_description: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fraser Film and Video
results.description: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.
description_for_label: Filmed in the remote Pilbara region in far north Western Australia this is a moving revelation of the struggle of women who are trying to create a life for themselves in the hostile environment of outback iron ore mining towns. “Time goes very slowly” deals with the problems of isolation and unemployment for women in Newman. “It’s not a community anymore” tells of the ongoing effects of the bitter 1986 Robe River industrial dispute upon families in the town of Wickham. “It’s supposed to be a town” explores racism through the eyes of both the black and white women of Newman.

results.title: Peach's Australia : The Dandenongs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
The Dandenong’s are the lungs of Melbourne, and an enchanting weekend tourist resort with rare plant and animal life. Its charm is now being eroded by urban sprawl
results.description:

results.title: [The White continent]
results.brief_description:
Please be advised, this film contains graphic footage of animal cruelty.

In late 1949, a joint expedition planned by the Governments of Britain, Norway and Sweden left for Queen Maude Land on the Antarctic continent - this was to be the first truly international expedition to the Antarctic. The film covers the first stage of the journey, from departure point in Europe to the establishment of the base camps and later withdrawal of the ship’s party, leaving the groups of scientists to their study of the unknown world of ice and snow. Photography by Tom Stobart.

results.title: From Melville to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Tristan Mungatopi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”
results.title_for_label: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey

He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”
